Experience Product Manager Intel Corporation May 2015  – Present (4 months) Campinas Area, Brazil UX Interaction Designer Intel Corporation May 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years 1 month) Campinas Area, Brazil UX Consultant Mercedes Sanchez Usabilidade e Pesquisa July 2005  –  April 2013  (7 years 10 months) São Paulo Area, Brazil Consulting on a project basis for Mercedes Sanchez Usability and Research I have been working with a great team of experts in user experience to deliver reports ranging from Expert Evaluations of websites to Contextual Research conducted in Brazil, Mexico and other Latin America countries. 
 
Nokia 
Contextual and ethnographic research to assess how people would use their cellphone cameras in their daily routine. Five country study led by Nokia's trends and forecast team that had each user walking around with a prototype, taking pictures everyday and keeping a diary. Experts would follow them and observe the interaction in context. A final interview with users got their take on the experience. 
 
Motorola 
Task driven tests on three different mobile OS to get the users insights on pros and cons of each. 
 
Skills developed: writing clear reports on areas for improvement and recommendations; group mediation and usability test orientation; knowledge of different methods to assess and point issues or possible solutions. Project Manager Biogen Laboratório de Imunogenética e Histocompatibilidade February 2005  –  April 2013  (8 years 3 months) Curitiba Area, Brazil Biogen is a privately held clinical laboratory with focus in Transplant Immunology. The company is government accredited and holds a contract under the brazilian public health program. Today, Biogen is part of Mantis, a single brand that represents a number of laboratories working in advanced diagnostic. Biogen also partners with Grupo Marista to manage the Transplant Immunology Laboratory of Cajuru Hospital, in Curitiba. 
 
Working from the Laboratory of Cajuru Hospital, I am responsible for overseeing matters concerning the partnership with Grupo Marista and leading projects to establish a business oriented culture and process. Among the most important projects are implementing a career plan to reflect the requirement for highly specialized people; establishing periodical performance evaluations and educating supervisors on how to deliver appraisals; integrating processes with Dyalisis Clinics to assure sample quality and adhesion of patients on the waiting list for a Kidney Transplant; turning all patient files into digital documents and outsourcing the archive; separation of clinical and research operations, with the research team consulting on clinical issues; delivering on only test results, but also knowledge by meeting with the clinicians in a weekly basis. 
 
Skills developed: understanding of the tests and techniques applied to better manage human and financial resources. Knowledge of the government processes and improvement of political skills while dealing with regulatory agencies, partners and fellow Laboratories. Information Architect, Information Architecture Coordinator AgênciaClick 2002  –  2006  (4 years) São Paulo Area, Brazil Consul 
While researching for creative concept, the team found that the company had a complete record of its history through an in company newsletter published since 1950s. As previous focus groups had shown that regular customers had a close relationship with the brand, recalling it as their mothers and grandmothers choice, the project was conceived to relate to that affection and, yet, improve direct sales. Going through the website, users are able to check all categories – Products, Consul, Recipes and Life – in different decades. From the coolest products in the 50s to the most popular recipes in the 60s, the way of life in the 70s, the modernization of the company throughout the 80s and 90s and the best products to buy online today.  
 
Brastemp You 
A Whirlpool brand in Brazil, Brastemp is known for product design and quality. In 2004, the company started working with Agência Click to develop the concept of a line of products only sold online that would let consumers choose colors and some parts of refrigerators and cooktops. While giving customers choice, chances of weird looking refrigerators coming out of the factory were haunting brand's designers. To guarantee the final product would not do the brand any harm, Brastemp decided to have rules regarding color matching, besides possible configurations of internal parts. Considering user experience, having restrictions on the colors one could choose was a huge set back. Using concepts of persuasive information architecture, the design was able to lead customers to the allowed choices and prevent frustration. Because the e-commerce team at Brastemp relied on the wireframes to carry all specification needed for programming, detail orientation was essential. 
 
Skills developed – ability to work with large amounts of content, edit and categorize it; problem solving oriented relationship with in house design team and extra company technology team; creative concept development and pitching; persuasive IA. Project Manager TV1 2000  –  2002  (2 years) São Paulo Area, Brazil Globo.com´s Portal do Chiquinho 
The project – Portal do Chiquinho is a kids´ website made on demand by TV1.com for Globo.com. The company was hired to get a first class team of writers and designers to create and maintain the website. The editors had freedom to produce and edit the content. Technology, developed in house, should otherwise fit Globo.com´s guidelines. Design team had to work along editors to illustrate content and define the site’s look. Project management was able to get all teams done at deadline, according to technological guidelines and content concept pitched in sale stage. 
 
Skills developed: ability to get three teams to speak the same language: writers aware of technological limits, designers ready to meet deadlines, technology team knowing the importance of making things possible. Strong analytical skills to anticipate, prevent or deal with problems that could hold back the project. Editor Editora Nova Cultural 1995  –  2000  (5 years) São Paulo Area, Brazil SuperGamePower was the best selling video games magazine in Brazil. I started working as a junior writer, getting thoughts and hints from teenage collaborators and writing as four alter-egos, each one with different personalities and, therefore, different writing styles. As an editor I started to contribute actively in the conception of new magazines or even new editorial projects for SuperGamePower. 
 
Skills developed: strong writing and editing ability. Leadership in a really young team not prepared to face a professional environment yet having to fit it and perform as expected. Summary I recently graduated from University at Buffalo with a Masters of Architecture and a Masters of Fine Arts in Media Production. At the University of Buffalo, I was the teaching assistant for a variety of technical courses in physical computing, web development, and building construction. Also studied abroad at the Bauhaus-Universität Weimar in the Media Architecture program. After studying the Situated Technologies Research Group, I completed a thesis that juxtaposes the interactions of physical proximal social space to distant digital social space to explore meaningful ways in which the interactions from social media can intersect with physical conversations.

I run the PDX UX Book Club, and am co-lead of IxDA Portland. Specialties:Wireframing, sketching, user research, competitive analysis, heuristic evaluation, information architecture design, usability testing.
